characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: Any units with Emboldened Masses special rule within 12" of an Auxilia Legion Standard add +1 to any combat resolution, inaddition they may reroll failed regroup tests.

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take up to two of the following

modifiers.value: Default weapon cannot be taken individually

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take one of the following

rules.name: In It for the Money
rules.description: Renegade Marauders may never attempt to regroup. In addition if this unit is taken in a detachment, any allied Space Marines(except those with Chapter Tactics (Astral Claws) special rule) count their Allegiance as one worse than usual.

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: A model with a flak armour gains a 6+ Save.

rules.name: Explosive Demise
rules.description: Whenever a model makes an attack with this weapon, remove it as a casualty after Initiative Step 0.

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take up to two of the following

modifiers.value: Default weapon cannot be taken individually

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take one of the following

characteristics.name: Description
characteristics.$text: If a unit contains a model with the Field Dressing Wargear, the entire unit gains the Feel No Pain (6+) Special Rule.

rules.name: Suicide Squad
rules.description: If a unit has the Suicide Squad special rule, the first time it is in combat, whether it charged or was charged, every model mustmake an attack with a Krak Grenade (Melee).

rules.name: Drown Then in Bodies!
rules.description: Units with this special rule may be taken as 1-3 units per Force Organisation Chart Slot

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take up to two of the following

modifiers.value: Default weapon cannot be taken individually

selectionEntryGroups.name: Must take one of the following
May take one of the following

rules.name: Weapons Drill
rules.description: If the unit doesn't move in its own Movement Phase, it may re-roll all 1's to hit in the following Shooting Phase.

rules.name: Mortal Transport
rules.description: This model may not transport any model with both the Chapter Tactics (X) Special rule and the Bulky (X) Special rule. In additionany model with the Chapter Tactics (X) special rule that may be Transported counts as 2 for Transport Capacity purposes.

rules.name: Towing Vehicle
rules.description: A Trojan may transport a single Auxilia Heavy Ordnance Crew consisting of a single Gun and Crew ignoring normal transportrestrictions.In addition, any unit with the Artillery Sub-Type within 6" of a Trojan Support Vehicle counts its weapons as being twin-linked.

rules.name: High Grade Promethium
rules.description: If a Hellhound Flame Tank is upgraded to High Grade Promethium it uses the alternate profile as detailed in the Weapons of theBadab War Document. In addition if the Vehicle explodes, it does so at 2D6" instead of the usual D6".

rules.name: Workhorse of the Fleet
rules.description: While chosen as a squadron for the purposes of army selection, each Arvus Lighter is treated as a separate unit during the gamerather than as part of a vehicle squadron and may deploy and operate independently of each other.

rules.name: Improvised Weapon Mounts
rules.description: A Zooming Arvus Lighter may only fire Snap Shots.

selectionEntryGroups.name: May take one of the following
Must take one of the following
Must take one of the following
Must take one of the following
Must take one of the following

rules.name: Immobile Artillery
rules.description: An Auxilia Heavy Ordnance Battery must have one Armsmen Gunner per Artillery Carriage in order for all Artillery Carriage tomake Shooting Attacks in the Shooting phase. If, at the start of any of the controlling players Shooting phases, the AuxiliaHeavy Ordnance Battery contains fewer Armsmen Gunners than Artillery Carriages then only a number of Artillery Carriagesequal to the number of Armsmen Gunners may make Shooting Attacks in that Shooting phase. In addition, as long as there areat least as many Auxilia Gunners in the unit as there are Artillery Carriages then the unit cannot be Pinned, automatically passingany Pinning tests it is called upon to take without any dice being rolled, and all Armsmen Gunners in the unit gain a bonus of +1to their Leadership Characteristic (this bonus is lost immediately once the number of Armsmen Gunners is reduced to less thanthe number of Artillery Carriages in the unit).

rules.name: Immobile Artillery
rules.description: Artillery Carriages may not move unless they are embarking or disembarking from a Trojan Support Vehicle.

selectionEntryGroups.name: May take one of the following
May take one of the following

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: Massive Blast (7"), Breaching (5+), Pinning, Shell Shock (3)

characteristics.name: Special Rules
characteristics.$text: Large Blast (5"), Breaching (6+), Shred, Pinning, Shell Shock (2)

rules.name: Reserves
rules.description: The Artillery Barrage always uses the Reserves special rules. Once the barrage is successfully rolled for it lands in the turn of theowning players Shooting Phase.

rules.name: Off-field Artillery
rules.description:
When the barrage beings, the owning player may select any point on the table visible to one of their models that is equippedwith a Command Vox, Vox Caster or Nuncio-Vox (If none are taken, or on the battlefield at this point, the opponent may placethe marker instead) to be the target of the barrage; this can be an enemy (or friendly if the enemy is placing it) unit or simply apoint on the table. Place a marker to represent this.

After the barrage has begun it will continue to land on this point in each of the owning players Shooting Phases until the end ofthe game.

If the controlling player wishes to move the marker at the start of their Shooting Phase any model with a Command Vox, VoxCaster or Nuncio-Vox may make the attempt to change its location. They must make a Leadership check at -2, if passed they mayplace it as above (without the need to roll for reserves again), if they fail, the enemy may place it where they please as therequest becomes garbled.

In addition, in Zone Mortalis Battles, or a battlefield with a roof the Artillery barrage may not be taken.

rules.name: (In)accuracy
rules.description: Each barrage will scatter from its target point each turn, roll normally for scatter, except that if a miss is rolled, the distance theshot scatters is double that shown on the 2D6 A hit remains a hit. This is not modified by any Ballistic Skill of any models.Equipment allowing models in Line of Site to re-roll a scatter such as Nuncio Voxes or Command Voxes do not allow rerolls of thescatter on these shots.

entryLinks.name: Two Sponson Mounted Gravis Heavy Bolters

selectionEntryGroups.name: May take one of the following

rules.name: Concealment Bulwark
rules.description: A model with the Concealment Bulwark may count its cover save a 2 better than usual (eg a 5+ going to a 3+). If the modelmoves for any reason, count this Wargear as destroyed. In addition anytime this model takes a successful penetrating hit, roll adice, on a 5+ the Concealment Bulwark Wargear is also destroyed.

rules.name: Symbol of the Tyrant
rules.description: Any model with either Emboldened Masses or Chapter Tactics (Astral Claws) special rules within 12" of a model with the Symbolof the Tyrant upgrade may make any Morale or Leadership checks on a 9 instead of their usual leadership.

entryLinks.name: Two Sponson Mounted Belt-fed Heavy Stubbers
Two Sponson Mounted Lascannons and Gravis Heavy Bolters

selectionEntryGroups.name: May take one of the following

rules.name: Open Crew Compartment
rules.description: Any Hits scored against a Vehicle with this special rule in close combat (including as part of a Death or Glory Advanced Reaction)and resolved against the Vehicle's Armour Facing with the lowest value.

rules.name: Support Detachment
rules.description: While all the models in this unit are purchased as a single Lord of War choice, they may be deployed individually on thebattlefield and do not need to follow the rules for a vehicle squadron.

rules.name: Anti-tank Mines
rules.description: A Vehicle must roll 2 dice when taking a dangerous terrain test and pick the worst result of the two when it moves over an Anti-tank minefield. In addition to this, Dozer Blades can not be used to reroll a failed dangerous terrain test when moving throughan Anti-Tank minefield.

rules.name: Mass Detonation
rules.description: If a blast of any kind scatters onto a Minefield Base, roll a D6. On a 1 the round has set off that section of the Minefield. Everymodel within D6" of the Minefield Base takes a S6 AP- hit, any models on or touching the minefield base take a S8 AP - Breaching(4+) hit, after resolving this, remove the Minefield Base from the battlefield.

rules.name: Minefield
rules.description: A Minefield counts as Dangerous Terrain for both armies.In addition to this a Dangerous Terrain check is failed on a 1 and 2. EachMinefield Base can be no larger than a 6"  2" rectangle. It must be deployed in the owning players deployment zone.

rules.name: Multi-part Fortification
rules.description: All component parts of a minefield must be deployed using the rules for Multi-part Fortifications.

sharedRules.name: Utterly Expendable
sharedRules.description: The opposing player never gains Victory points for specifically destroying thisunit in missions where this is relevant. his includes for secondary objectives suchas First Blood, but this does not affect Victory points based on the number oftotal units destroyed in a particular game (such as for Attrition).

sharedRules.name: Emboldened Masses
sharedRules.description:
A model with this rule counts as having the Chapter Tactics (Astral Claws) specialrule for use with the following items:
- Chapter Standard Wargear
- Mealstrom Warder Special Rule

sharedRules.name: Prefect's Discipline
sharedRules.description: While the Cohorts Prefect is still alive, the squad may re-roll Leadership Checks for regrouping.

sharedRules.name: Maelstrom Fleet Local Strikes
sharedRules.description: While chosen as a squadron for the purposes of army selection, each Vehicle is treated as a separate unit during the game ratherthan as part of a vehicle squadron and may deploy and operate independently of each other.

sharedRules.name: The Tyrant's Chosen
sharedRules.description: These vehicles are crewed by Astartes, or at the very least commanded by an Astartes, therefore this vehicle gains the ChapterTactics (Astral Claws) Trait as well as an increased Ballistic Skill (already added above). In addition, if this vehicle conveys anyvictory points to the opposing player, those points are doubled.

rules.name: Astral Claws Chapter Support
rules.description:
For every Astral Claws Tactical Squad included within the army it allows you toinclude a single choice from the Forces of the Adeptus Astartes with the ChapterTactics (Astral Claws) Special Rule in any given force organisation slot. If any ofthese units may take a Dedicated Transport, it may be taken as usual and doesntcount against the number of Astral Claws Chapter Support units in the army.


In addition to this you may not have more units taken as Astral Claws ChapterSupport than you do Human Auxiliary Units.
